title: Baadab Soort Springs
content: Baadab Soort springs, registered as one of the country's natural-national sights, are a rare instance of travertine springs that have created eye-catching displays of colorful deposits. Situated in the Kiasar region south of Mazandaran province in the vicinity of Semnan province, these springs have the village of Arvast in their nearest neighbor. The distinguishing feature of such springs is the natural formation of step-like basins after the settlement of colorful travertine deposits along the mild slope of a hill. The colors of red, brown, orange, and cream have combined here to create extraordinary scenery. Although such springs can also be found in other parts of the world (for instance, Pamukkale in Turkey), the color combination of Baadab Soort shows higher excellence and attractiveness from an aesthetic point of view.
